page.title: 04ECOLOGY CONTINUED.
page.content: BUGLE, COW PARSLEY, WOOD SORREL, CUCKOO PINT AND HORSETAIL. EVIDENCE OF ANIMAL LIFE FOUND WAS SPIDERS, WOODLICE ANTS AND MILLIPEDES WITHIN THE GROUND LAYER. OUR THIRD AREA OF WOODLAND WAS GRID SQUARE 03720322 . THE MAP SHOWS THIS AS MIXED WOODLAND BUT THE SECTION WE STUDIED WAS CONIFEROUS. AS FAR AS WE COULD TELL THE TREES WERE PLANTED BECAUSE THEY WERE AN EVEN DISTANCE APART AND THE SAME SPECIES OF TREES GREW TOGETHER. THE TIMBER IS PROBABLY USED FOR POLES AND FENCING. THE TREES WERE PINE, SPRUCE AND LARCH WHICH WERE ALL ABOUT THE SAME HEIGHT OF ABOUT THIRTY METRES. THERE WERE FEWER CANOPY LAYERS. THE LOWER BRANCHES HAD BEEN CUT OFF SOME OF THE TREES LETTING SOME SUNLIGHT THROUGH. THERE WAS NOT SUCH A VARIETY OF TREES AND PLANTS AS THAT FOUND AT PULESTON COMMON. THIS IS
